recipesJson.name: Creamy Cookie Dough
recipesJson.author: MrColdOne
recipesJson.description: I've been playing around with FLV cookie dough for a little bit, and after Wayne released Obsidian it definitely inspired me. FLV cookie dough is a little weird to work with, at first I really didn't like it. It almost has an RY4 taste to it right away as weird as that sounds, to me atleast. But I can see why Wayne went that route. With some supporting flavors and of course a little time it does come out pretty tasty! I don't add any sweetener here, and it probably would benefit from some, so add .5% super sweet if you want. FLV Cookie Dough, and FLV Frosting are a little harsh right away, so I do like to add a little more VG. This is my spin off from Obsidian, here I present MrColdOnes Creamy Cookie Dough!

reviews.text: checks out... the ingredients seem right up my alley... I will give this a mix and let you know how it is after a week or two's steep! :) just noticed the ingredients seem quite modern considering this has been out for some time too. Thanks frosty!
A delicious, rich cookie. The cream took 2 weeks to settle down for me. Once it did, the butterscotch and hazelnut came through delectably.

I just mixed this up so it hasn't steeped yet, but already this is a very tasty recipe. I love any chance to use flv cookie dough. I liked it so much I also mixed up a version with wf chocolate chunks in it. Well done.
